definitions.definition: ( often followed by a preposition such as "to" or "on" ) To fasten or attach (something) with a pin.
( chess , usually passive voice ) To cause (a piece) to be in a pin.

examples: He pinned his opponent on the mat.

definitions.definition: To enclose; to confine; to pen; to pound.
( graphical user interface , transitive ) To attach (an icon, application, message etc.) to another item so that it persists.
examples: to pin a folder to the taskbar

definitions.definition: ( programming , transitive ) To fix (an array in memory , a security certificate , etc.) so that it cannot be modified .
examples: When marshaling data, the interop marshaler can copy or pin the data being marshaled.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause an analog gauge to reach the stop pin at the high end of the range.
( bodybuilding , slang , ambitransitive ) To inject for performance enhancement .
( backgammon ) To move a piece onto a blot , preventing the piece from further movement.
